intro: Coccothrinax acunana, commonly known as the Cuban palm, is a flowering plant species native to Cuba. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by elongated, spiky fruits. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
